com.topright.roboticon

Class BuyRoboticonsMarketTestCase

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.topright.roboticon.GuiTest
      • com.topright.roboticon.BuyRoboticonsMarketTestCase

  • public class BuyRoboticonsMarketTestCase
extends GuiTest
    Test case for the BuyRoboticonsMarket class

    Unfortunately due to the design of the BuyRoboticonsClass, many of these tests are not true unit tests as the class depends on a SpinBox object and MessagePopUp objects that cannot be mocked out, although it would not make sense for us to inject this dependency into the class in this case (i.e. pass the SpinBox to the class via its constructor). So we feel justified that the design decisions we made were sensible (even if they make unit testing hard).

    Author:
    jcn509

      void setup() 
      void TestClickCompletePurchaseButtonFiveRoboticons()
      Ensures that when the transaction quantity spinbox is set to 5 and the complete purchase button clicked the attemptToBuyRoboticons method from the player class is called with an input value of 5
      void TestClickCompletePurchaseButtonOneRoboticon()
      Ensures that when the transaction quantity spinbox is set to 1 and the complete purchase button clicked the attemptToBuyRoboticons method from the player class is called with an input value of 1
      void TestClickCompletePurchaseButtonZeroRoboticons()
      Ensures that when the transaction quantity spinbox is set to 0 and the complete purchase button clicked the attemptToBuyRoboticons method from the player class is not called
      void TestClickCompletePurchaseFailed()
      Ensures that when the players purchase fails for whatever reason (i.e.
      void TestClickCompletePurchaseFailNoMessageDispatched()
      Ensures a message is not dispatched stating that the player's inventory has been updated when the player's purchase fails
      void TestClickCompletePurchaseMessageDispatched()
      Ensures a message is dispatched stating that the player's inventory has been updated when the player's purchase does not fail
      void TestClickCompletePurchaseNoPopUp()
      Ensures that when the players purchase does not fail that a MessagePopUp is not created.
      void TestProduceRoboticonButton()
      Ensures that when the produce roboticon button is clicked that the appropriate method in the market class is called
      void TestProduceRoboticonFail()
      Ensures that when the produce roboticon button is clicked and that market fails to produce a roboticon (because it does not have enough ore) that a MesagePopUp is created to alert the user to this.
      void TestProduceRoboticonNoPopUp()
      Ensures that when the market does not fail to produce a roboticon a MessagePopUp is not created
